results.title: Effects of prostaglandins inhibition on changes in active and inactive renin induced by antihypertensive drugs.
results.text_hl: These data suggest that @CHEMICAL_Prostaglandins @CHEMICAL_MESH:D011453 @@@prostaglandins@@@ stimulate, even if not to a similar extent, both AR and @DISEASE_HAIR_AN_syndrome @DISEASE_MESH:C537629 @@@IR@@@ and that drugs, which stimulate @GENE_REN @GENE_5972 @@@renin@@@ either through or independently of @CHEMICAL_Phosphatidylglycerols @CHEMICAL_MESH:D010715 @@@PGs@@@, did not cause any apparent interconversion of plasma @DISEASE_HAIR_AN_syndrome @DISEASE_MESH:C537629 @@@IR@@@ into AR. In 6 pts @<m>CHEMICAL_Atenolol</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D001262 @@@atenolol@@@ (100 mg daily/6 days) reduced @<m>DISEASE_Androgen_Insensitivity_Syndrome</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D013734 @@@AR@@@ (p less than 0.05) and tended to increase @DISEASE_HAIR_AN_syndrome @DISEASE_MESH:C537629 @@@IR@@@.

citations.NLM: Salvetti A, Pedrinelli R, Sassano P, Arzilli F, Turini F. Effects of prostaglandins inhibition on changes in active and inactive renin induced by antihypertensive drugs. Clin Exp Hypertens A. 1982;4(11-12):2435-48. PMID: 6756707
